Good afternoon LHS families! Here are 8 Tips to Help Your Child Learn at Home.
By Sean J. Smith, PhD
1. Create a learning space for your child.
2. Make a schedule and stick to it.
3. Reduce distractions.
4. Use a calendar and color-code it.
5. Get plenty of exercise.
6. See which accessibility features help your child.
7. Reach out to your child’s teacher.
8. Look for ways to remove learning barriers.
Read more on these tips at: https://www.understood.org/en/school-learning/learning-at-home/homework-study-skills/online-learning-how-to-prepare-child
~ LHS #lhollingworthschool #number1patriot #lhs419

Hello, Parents of L. Hollingworth School!

My name is Danielle Robertson and I am a licensed therapist through Linking Families Therapy Group located at your school. I know many of our students are worried regarding the events of COVID-19 so I wanted to share that I am readily available to you and your family during this crisis in-person AND via telehealth. What's telehealth, you ask? It's a web-based form of counseling in which you can use your phone, tablet, or computer to engage in face-to-face interaction with your therapist or doctor. If you're interested in getting started, please check out my profile on Psychology Today ( https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/therapists/danielle-nicole-robertson-toledo-oh/484226 ) to learn more about me and the services I provide. We can discuss how to get things started via phone call. Stay healthy!

Danielle
#lhollingworthschool #number1patriot
